recurrence_setup_h.intro_Txt: This page allows you to set up a recurring event with a specific interval or a specific number of times in a period of time.
recurrence_setup_h.txt:
Name - Enter a descriptive name for the recurrence.

Recurrency pattern/Repeat every - Set up a specific pattern for the recurrency. For example, every 2 hours (starting the following hour, on the hour). When using the day(s) option the action is triggered at 00:00:00.
recurrence_setup_h.txt_extra_info: To use the recurrence in an Action Rule, first select Time from the Trigger drop-down list in the Action Rule Setup page and then select the recurrence from the second drop-down list.
recurrence_setup_h.txt_note: Note - a recurrence may not happen at the expected time set because the next recurrence uses the last occurred recurrence as a time reference point.
recurrence_setup_h.txt_note_example:
Example:

The Axis product uses epoch (1970-01-01T00:00:00Z ISO 8601) as a time reference in Recurrence setup, that is the time when the first recurrence occured.
recurrence_setup_h.example_setup_Txt: Go to Setup > System Options > Date & Time. Set manually the Axis product's time to 11:55.
recurrence_setup_h.example_setup_Txt1: Go to Setup > Events > Schedules. Create a schedule that starts at 12:00 and ends at 12:10 (every day).
recurrence_setup_h.example_setup_Txt2: Go to Setup > Events > Recurrences. Create a recurrence that triggers once every 7th minute.
recurrence_setup_h.example_setup_Txt3: Go to Setup > Events > Action rules, click Add and set up an action rule that triggers on the recurrence and the schedule created in step 2 and 3.
recurrence_setup_h.example_setup_Txt4: Wait until 12:00 and note when the recurrence will trigger.
recurrence_setup_h.txt_note_1example: Using epoch as a time reference, during the first hour after occurance of the first recurrence, the Action Rule will be triggered in the following minutes intervals 0 7 14 21 28 35 42 49 56.
recurrence_setup_h.txt_note_1example-1: Based on the above setup and the product using epoch as a time reference, during the first hour, the Action rule will be triggered in the following minutes intervals 0 7 14 21 28 35 42 49 56.
recurrence_setup_h.txt_note_2example: During the second hour, recurrence will occur in the following minutes intervals 3 10 17 24 31 38 45 53 because the product uses the last occurred recurrence as a time reference.
recurrence_setup_h.txt_note_3example: If for example a recurrence is set to occur at 13:00, the Action Rule will be triggered before 13:00hr. Therefore recurrences may not happen at the exact specified time.

recurrences_h.intro_Txt: This page allows you to set up an recurring event with a specific interval or a specific number of times in a period of time.
recurrences_h.list_Txt1: Listed here are the recurrences that have already been set up:
recurrences_h.list_Txt2: Name - The name entered by the user when the recurrence was set up.
recurrences_h.list_Txt3: Recurrency pattern - Shows the specific pattern the recurrency was set up for. For example, if it was set up to run every 2 hours or specific time period for example 1 hour and 15 minutes.
recurrences_h.button_Txt: To create a new recurrence, click Add.... To change an existing recurrence, select it in the list and click Modify... To delete a recurrence, select it and click Remove.
recurrences_h.link_Txt: See Recurrence Setup for more information on how to set Recurrences.
